https://community.upwork.com/t5/Freelanc.title: Re: Profile hide for other freelancer

Anant M: Hi, Up-work.I'm a freelacer and I want to hide my profile for any other freelancer. That means any other freelancer can not see my Profile. any client can see but any freelancer just like me can not see my profile..I want to do that. IS that any chance to do that..???Please let me know and guid me that how to do..Thanks in advance.
Seyed J: Hi,As I know, you can't achieve this. There is no option to show your profile to all the clients and hide it for all freelancers.There are three options on UpWork for profile visibility which is:I think the best option for you is to use the Private mode.You can change your Profile Visibility on the UpWork homepage (click on the Find Work link under Find Work on the header navigation). Find for Visibility in the sidebar and edit it.I hope it helps.
Preston H: If you don't want someone to see something, don't put it online.It does not make sense to try to block one individual (or block ONLY freelancers) from seeing your profile page. I could look at your profile page and send a copy of it to that individual. Anyone who is a client might also be a freelancer.Upwork is not intended as a tool for hiding information. It is intended as tool for maximizing a freelancer's exposure to potential clients. So blocking people from seeing our profile pages (which are our online billboards) isn't really at the heart of what the system is all about.
Petra R: any client can see but any freelancer just like me can not see my profile..Why?IS that any chance to do that..???No, there is no chance to do that.

Erin J: Okay, Thanks for letting me know.

Petra R: Actually I worked with this guy and completed the first job on Upwork successfully using his account.How did you think this would be acceptable?Is it possible?No

Jaaziyah S: Does anyone know how I can get in touch with someone from Upwork?Get help button is not working and I am unable to delete manual hours from my work diary.
Bojan S: HiJaaziyah,You should be able to delete yourtime in the current week’s Work Diary in an active contract.Could you please share more information about the issue you're experiencing when you try to delete the time from your Work Diary so that we can assist you accordingly?Thank you!
Preston H: You don't need to work through Upwork. If you end up with hours getting billed to the client that you don't want the client to pay for, all you need to do is send the client a refund.

https://community.upwork.com/t5/New-to-U.title: Re: Get Profile Feedback from Experienced Freelancers on Upwork

Koorosh M: Greetings;May you please review my profile? It's like 3 days with 20 propsals scince I got back to Upwork. But no interviews. I would like to know what is the problem with my profile.Best regards.Farewell.
Eva H: I have read "Getting Started" tips, attended the "Getting Started" webinar, and tried many different approaches to my proposal structure. (including a willingness to work for very low fees just to establish a reputation on here) I have a clear understanding of my competitive advantage message. I am a very seasoned professional, just new to Upwork.Any advice on breaking this no-hire spell? Thank you so much in advance!EvaPS-To add insult to injury my profile was "hidden" for "lack of earnings". It's not due to not trying and being penalized is not helping the matter.
Aditi J: Eva, I hear you. I have been in spots where Upwork terms and conditions seemed unhelpful. But it is the freelancer community that helped me to navigate this framework. You are in the right spot. Apart from me, other more experienced freelancers may have suggestions for you too. So please check back periodically.1) Consider adding a video to your profile. When I looked at high earners in your field (e.g. Melissa, or Courtney), adding video seems to be a norm. If you disagree, you might want to change your title. I used your title to do a search and these freelancers showed up.2) Consider adding more portfolio items. These items can be from your assignments on other platforms or sample assignments that you created solely for portfolio purposes. (Although Melissa and Courtney did not have an exhaustive portfolio, several other have 10+ items).3) Consider developing catalog products/pre-packaged products. A potential client can reach you in three different ways- look at your profile and send you a direct message, Or they post a job and you respond to it. Or they look at a catalog product that you have and hire you. At present, you do not have catalog products. Connect with Upwork rep if you need more information about Catalogs. (I myself have not yet developed Catalog products due to technical glitches but I plan to do it during the Spring break.)Hope this helps, I'm rooting for your success.
Tahmid C: I am a CMS, Shopify and Laravel developer. Looking to start my journey at Upwork. I will really appriciate if someone reviews my profile.Thank you
Joseph T: Greetings Upwork Family!I am unable to secure high-paying jobs/projects yet I am a Top-Rated freelancer. I have tried every trick 'in the book' and feel that I have hit a dead-end. I am outof ideas! So far, I have;a. Updated my profile accordingly.b. Implemented all the tips I have learnt on bidding for jobs(which worked just fine last year).I have not received any invitations by clients, yet I got so many last year.What do you advise/recommend that I do? Thank you in advance.
Robin H: Greetings Upwork Family!I am unable to secure high-paying jobs/projects yet I am a Top-Rated freelancer. I have tried every trick 'in the book' and feel that I have hit a dead-end. I am outof ideas! So far, I have;a. Updated my profile accordingly.b. Implemented all the tips I have learnt on bidding for jobs(which worked just fine last year).I have not received any invitations by clients, yet I got so many last year.What do you advise/recommend that I do? Thank you in advance.I'm a marketing copywriter. Check out my profile and compare it with yours. You list qualifications, but you have no story. As a content writer, I expect more. Why hire you rather than the other Top-Rated freelancers? It's really hard to get started on the platform so you need to find ways to stand out.Likewise, your proposals need to be customized to each job post.

I only apply to jobs I know I can really do well, but it seems like I'm wasting my time as nobody is even viewing my profile (I see I had one view this past week which is the same as the previous week), but I have sent out around 44 proposals this year. I would really, really appreciate if some of you amazing freelancers could have a look at my profile and share some thoughts on why I am not being successful?Here is a link to my profile:Natalie Bowman UpWork ProfileThank you so much, Natalie

https://community.upwork.com/t5/New-to-U.title: Re: Why must I upload a photo with my face?!

Goran V: Hi Geoffrey,You can update your profile image at any time by going to your profile > hover over your image > click on the pencil case. You can also check out our blog post about:A How-To Guide for Your Perfect Profile Picture. Thank you.
Bojan S: Hi Safa,Thank you for reaching out to us. Could you please try again to upload your profile photowith niqab. Let us know if you need any further assistance.Thank you!
Salma H: Oh, Salma, this is a tricky one, right? I'm all for you earning your own income. I'm all for women all over the world, however they choose to present themselves, earning their own income. But, the rules of this platform are that you have to show your face in your profile photo. The "human element" in online freelancing is an important one for various reasons: the internet is largely impersonal and work is very personal, being able to see the face of the person with whom you are working brings the project from the anonymous internet into the realm of actual work done by actual people, it engenders trust. While your niqab in no way makes you less human, it does cover up a very defining human feature - your face. It's the same reason freelancers are not allowed to use profile photos in which they are wearing sunglasses - they visually obscure the face and serve to conceal identity.I totally understand your point of view and I'm not against it. I would like my customers to build trust in me too of course. But It doesn't make sense to give up one of my beliefs in exchange to that right?Like I said, there are lot of "more reliable" methods to verify my identity without having to upload a photo of my face, like verifying my idenity and face with my National ID through customer support or something like that (like I did in other websites) instead of posting a public picture to all people.Thanks for your reply and respecting my way of representing myself.
Nina K: Hi Salma,Please see our response about a similar question in this thread, and to confirm what Petra stated, our support team can assist you with being able to upload your photo while wearing the Niqab.

Chuck P: It would be very helpful to have an option in the Job Search filters to be able to filter postings by posting date. Some postings are very old and not relevant any longer. It seems that anything older than two weeks is no longer being reviewed by the poster.
